admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

abstracts.cdata!:
This document summarizes the
            environmental assessment for the Fifth Inland Waterways
            Project in China, which consists mainly of the construction
            of the Cuijiaying Navigation and Power Complex, discusses
            the likely negative environmental impacts, and proposes
            measures to mitigate them. Proposed measures to reduce risks
            include the following: Prevent floods by maintaining normal
            levels for dams and reservoirs. Adopt measures to prevent
            riverbank erosion and dam breaches. Promote repair and
            maintenance of the flood release gates and channels, and
            provide incentives to promote water and electricity
            conservation. Collect wastewater in sedimentation tanks,
            acquire underground sewage treatment equipment and use
            septic tanks for temporary residences. Spray water regularly
            to damp down dust, and promptly clean up dirt scattered by
            construction machinery. Choose low-volume construction
            machinery, schedule work for daytime, and impose time limits
            in sensitive areas. Adopt water and soil erosion prevention
            measures such as building retaining walls, protecting
            slopes, and drainage systems. Promptly refill earth and tamp
            id needed if there is (tree) cutting. Recover vegetation
            promptly from borrow pits and disposal areas for excavated
            materials. Regularly monitor the environment. Protect
            cultural relics. Avoid discharging industrial wastewater
            into reservoir area and other water bodies unless
            pre-treated to reduce pollution. Ships and vessels are
            banned from discharging waste oil, manure, and garbage into
            water bodies, and they must be equipped with oil-water
            separators. Ships and vessels must also be controlled for
            noise. Apply regulations to prevent accidental spills of
            hazardous waste; leaks and spills must promptly be reported.
            Establish a fishery protection system.
